dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S2927 IS: Inspectors General Streamlining Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Coburn introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To strengthen Inspector General audits and investigations by streamlining computer matching agreements.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Inspectors General Streamlining Act
.
Section 6 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the terms agency, matching program, and record have the meanings given those terms in section 552a(a) of title 5, United States Code.

In addition to the authority otherwise provided by this Act, each Inspector General, in conducting an audit, investigation, inspection, evaluation, or other review authorized under this Act, may compare any records with other records or non-Federal records.

For purposes of section 552a of title 5, United States Code, or any other provision of law, a comparison of records with other records or non-Federal records performed by an Inspector General or by an agency participating with an Inspector General under the authority described in paragraph (2) shall not be considered a matching program.
